error.account_fetching: Information is not available at the moment. Please, check if the account name is correct or try later.
error.account_not_found: Account ${account_id} not found. Please, check if the account name is correct or try later.

error.block_fetching: Information is not available at the moment. Please, check if the block hash is correct or try later.

error.transaction_fetching: Information is not available at the moment. Please, check if the transaction hash is correct or try later.

ValidatorRow.warning_tip: Validators 1 - ${node_tip_max} hold a cumulative stake above 33%. Delegating to the validators below improves the decentralization of the network.

proposal.title: Proposal
proposal.text: node staked to be new validating one

idle.title: Idle
idle.text: staking pool that has less than 20% of the current seat price

newcomer.title: Newcomer
newcomer.text: staking pool that has at least 20% of the current seat price

on_hold.title: On hold
on_hold.text: staking pool has enough tokens to validate, but hasn’t submitted a stake proposal yet

uptime.text: Uptime is estimated by the ratio of the number of produced blocks to the number of expected blocks.
uptime.title: Uptime

latest_produced_block.text: The block height the validation node reported in the most recent telemetry heartbeat.
latest_produced_block.title: Latest block

latest_telemetry_update.text: Telemetry is a regular notification coming from the nodes which includes generic information like the latest known block height, and the version of NEAR Protocol agent (nearcore).
latest_telemetry_update.title: Latest Telemetry Update

node_agent_name.text: NEAR Protocol could have multiple implementations, so agent is the name of that implementation, where 'near-rs' is ${agent_name_url}.
node_agent_name.title: Node Agent Name

pool_info_tip.text: If you are node owner feel free to fill all ${pool_info_url} to promote your own node!

signed_by.title: Signed by
signed_by.text: Account that signed and sent the transaction.

status.title: Status
status.text: Current status of the transaction (Pending, Succeeded, Failed/Finalized or non finalized).

transaction_fee.title: Transaction Fee
transaction_fee.text: Total fee paid in NEAR to execute this transaction.

deposit_value.title: Deposit Value
deposit_value.text: Sum of all NEAR tokens transferred from the Signing account to the Receiver account. This includes tokens sent in a Transfer action(s), and as deposits on Function Call action(s).

gas_used.title: Gas Used
gas_used.text: Units of gas required to execute this transaction.

attached_gas.title: Attached Gas
attached_gas.text: Units of gas attached to the transaction (this is often higher than 'Gas Used').

created.title: Created
created.text: Timestamp of when this transaction was submitted.

block_hash.title: Block Hash
block_hash.text: Unique identifier (hash) of the block this transaction was included in.

ReceiptsInBlock.no_receipts: There are no receipts in this block

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.text: Number of transactions in this block.

status.title: Status
status.text: Current status of the block (finalizing or finalized).

gas_used.title: Gas Used
gas_used.text: Total units of gas used by transactions in this block.

gas_price.title: Gas Price
gas_price.text: A unit of Tgas (TeraGas) is 1*10^12 units of gas. The costs of gas are very low in terms of NEAR, which is why Tgas is more commonly used.

created.title: Created
created.text: Timestamp of when this block finalized.

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.text: Total transaction sent and received by this account.

storage_usage.title: Storage Used
storage_usage.text: Total blockchain storage (in bytes) used by this account.

native_account_balance.title: Ⓝ Native Account Balance
native_account_balance.text: NEAR protocol defines a liquid balance for every account, this is directly used to pay for transactions issued by this account, but it is not the "total" balance of all the tokens you may control through this account; see "Aggregated Balace" for more details.

validator_stake.title: Ⓝ Validator Stake
validator_stake.text:
This NEAR is actively being used to back a validator and secure the network. When you decide to unstake this NEAR, it will take some time to be shown in your Available Balance, as NEAR takes 3 epochs (~36 hours) to unstake.

This field only reflects NEAR balance for validators that stake to support the security of the network. If you’re staking (delegating) to a validator pool from a wallet, you will see "0" in this field. See the balance profile on Wallet for more balances aggregated for your convenience.

balance_profile.title: Ⓝ Balance Profile
balance_profile.text: NEAR tokens can be locked in contracts, staked, and delegated, and sometimes we cannot even track them down without your help. Wallet Profile page is the place where we consolidate most of the balances we can aggregate from various sources, so if you want to estimate "total" balance, it is the best place.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.text: Date and time when this account was created. Some of the accounts are included in the very first block of the network called genesis.

created_by_transaction.title: Created By Transaction
created_by_transaction.text: You can inspect the transaction which created this account.

deleted_at.title: Deleted At
deleted_at.text: Date and time when this account was deleted.

deleted_by_transaction.title: Deleted By Transaction
deleted_by_transaction.text: You can inspect the transaction which deleted this account.

lockup_account.title: Lockup Account
lockup_account.text: Lockup is a special smart contract that ensures that the full amount or even a partial amount is not transferable until it is supposed to be.

transaction_hash.title: Transaction Hash
transaction_hash.text: The transaction unique identifier (hash) that the contract is latest deployed.

locked.title: Locked?
locked.text:
Locked contract means that there are no access keys allowing the contract code to be re-deployed.

In general case, the code can be re-deployed by:

  1. a transaction with a deploy-code action
  2. the contract itself can implement a function call that will trigger deploy-code action

To re-deploy the code with a transaction, the transaction has to be signed with a full-access key. If there is no such key on the contract, there is no way to re-deploy the code unless there is a dedicated support in the contract code itself, and thus we mark such contracts as locked.

If there is at least one full-access key registered on the contract account, the contract is not locked.

code_hash.title: Code Hash
code_hash.text: Checksum (SHA-256 in base58 encoding) of the contract binary.

block_height.title: Block Height
block_height.text:
The most recent block height recorded to the blockchain.

The block height is a sequential number of the most recent block in the blockchain.

For example, a block height of 1000 indicates that up to 1001 blocks may exist in the blockchain (genesis + blocks 0-1000). In NEAR, there is not guaranteed to be a block for each sequential number, e.g. block 982 does not necessarily exist.

avg_block_time.title: Avg block time
avg_block_time.text: Average time for producing one block.

24h_total.title: 24hr Total
24h_total.text: The number of transactions in the last 24 hours.

gas_price.title: Gas Price
gas_price.text: A unit of Tgas (TerraGas) is 1*10^12 units of gas. The costs of gas are very low in terms of NEAR, which is why Tgas is more commonly used.

tooltip.total_tokens_supply_explain: NEAR tokens that are available for circulation on the market (i.e. not locked in lockup contracts)

ActiveAccountsList.title: Top 10 of Active Accounts in last 14 days

ActiveContractsList.title: Top 10 of Active Contracts in last 14 days

StakingBar.title: Stake Volume for Validating Nodes
StakingBar.total_stake_volume_for_current_epoch_is: Total Stake Volume for current epoch is

Search.title: Search
Search.hint: Search for Account ID, Receipt ID, Txn hash, Block hash, or Block height
